title: Extract Water from Tropical Vines
brief: Obtain drinking water from tropical vines using a two-cut method to release stored liquids.
steps: Step 1: Locate suitable tropical vines - avoid any that appear damaged or diseased.
Step 2: Cut a notch in the vine as high as you can safely reach.
Step 3: Cut the vine off close to the ground below your first cut.
Step 4: Position a container under the bottom cut to catch the dropping liquid.
Step 5: Alternatively, position your mouth directly under the flow to drink.
Step 6: Allow all liquid to drain from the vine section before discarding.
warnings: Do not drink liquid if it is sticky, milky, or bitter tasting - these indicate toxicity.
Test small amounts first before consuming larger quantities.
Some vine liquids can be poisonous - always check taste and consistency first.
